original: dge slong lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na thur ma sor bzhi tsam 'dzugs pa ma gtogs par sa tshig pa dang / nyams pa dang / sa zhag dang / rdo thal rgyu dang / bye ma la sogs pa ma gtogs pa sa'i rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid dang /🔽rtsig pa nyid dang / khang thog dang / 'dus pa dag la sa'i shas che ba la sogs pa dag la de ltar 'du shes pas /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na thur ma sor bzhi tsam 'dzugs pa ma gtogs par sa tshig pa dang / nyams pa dang / sa zhag dang / rdo thal rgyu dang / bye ma la sogs pa ma gtogs pa sa'i rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid dang / rtsig pa nyid dang / khang thog dang / 'dus pa dag la sa'i shas che ba la sogs pa dag la de ltar 'du shes pas /
translated: If a monk who is not a physician does not make a hole in the ground using the method of the constellations, but digs a hole more than four fingerbreadths deep, except for a hole in burned or damaged ground, in ground with salt, in ground with gravel, in ground with sand, and so on, in hard ground that is not earth,

original: gzhig pa'i blos rko'am /
analyzed: gzhig pa'i blos rko'am /
translated: in a wall, in a roof, or in a building, in places where the earth is mixed with other substances, and so on, if he does so with the perception that it is earth,🔽with the intention to destroy it, and he digs it himself

original: rkor bcug na /
analyzed: rkor bcug na /
translated: or has it dug,

original: lan re btab pa'i sbyor ba re re las rko ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan re btab pa'i sbyor ba re re las rko ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then for each time he gives the order, he commits the actual downfall of digging.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /🔽sa'i sa rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni / sa'i sa rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid la sogs pa la /
translated: The agent of this downfall🔽is a monk who is not a physician.

original: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factor is the perception that the ground is earth.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is completed by five factors:

original: dge slong lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na /
translated: The monk Karabha made it permissible by the conjunction of the stars.🔽Except for the insertion of a four-finger-width

original: thur ma sor bzhi tsam 'dzugs pa ma gtogs @214a * //🔽pa nyid dang / sa'i rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / gzhig pa'i blo nyid dang / rko'am /
analyzed: thur ma sor bzhi tsam 'dzugs pa ma gtogs @214a * // pa nyid dang / sa'i rang bzhin can 'thas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / gzhig pa'i blo nyid dang / rko'am /
translated: peg,

original: rkor bcug pa'o //
analyzed: rkor bcug pa'o //
translated: the nature of the earth is hard, the perception of it is that, the intention is the thought, “I will dig,” or “I will have it dug,” and the conclusion is when it has been dug or has been had dug.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors are incomplete, then the downfall is a slight one.

original: sa rko ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: sa rko ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This was the seventy-third downfall.

original: // / mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis for the downfall of staying away from an invitation is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi nang na ljongs rgyu zheng gzhegs pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi nang na ljongs rgyu zheng gzhegs pa na /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Śākya, was traveling through the Śākya country.

original: ser skya'i gnas su byon nas ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: ser skya'i gnas su byon nas ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: He arrived at Kapilavastu and stayed in the Nyagrodha Park.

original: sh'akya ming chen gyis de thos nas bsams pa ;
analyzed: sh'akya ming chen gyis de thos nas bsams pa ;
translated: Mahānāman, a Śākya, heard that the Blessed One had arrived and was staying in the Nyagrodha Park.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa /🔽lan mang du gdugs chod la khyim gzhan du spyan drangs te /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa / lan mang du gdugs chod la khyim gzhan du spyan drangs te /
translated: I have often invited the Blessed One and the community of monks🔽to a meal in my house,

original: bshos gsol la /
analyzed: bshos gsol la /
translated: and I have served them food.

original: lan 'ga' yang yo byad thams cad kyis spyan ma drangs kyis /
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang yo byad thams cad kyis spyan ma drangs kyis /
translated: But I have never invited them with all the necessities.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drang ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drang ngo snyam mo //
translated: I will invite the Blessed One and the community of monks for four months with all the necessities.”

original: de nas sh'akya ming chen bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Then the Śākya Mahānāman went to the Blessed One. When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das sh'akya ming chen la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas / bcom ldan 'das sh'akya ming chen la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
translated: When he had sat to one side,🔽the Blessed One, through talk consistent with the Dharma, instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: enthused, and delighted the Śākya Mahānāman.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: Having taught them in many ways with a discourse on the Dharma,🔽having gladdened them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: having delighted them, he remained silent.

original: de nas sh'akya ming chen stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen stan las langs te /
translated: Then Mahānāman the Śākya rose from his seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: bowed down at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, please accept from me, together with the saṅgha of monks,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dgung zla bzhir bdag gi na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dgung zla bzhir bdag gi na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /
translated: robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick for four months.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya ming chen @214b la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya ming chen @214b la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to Mahānāman the Śākya by remaining silent.

original: de nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
translated: Then, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Śākya Mahānāman bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song nas des bsnyung bar rung ba'i khang pa rtsig tu bcug cing bsnyung ba'i sman yang 'jog tu bcug / bde ba'i sman dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song nas des bsnyung bar rung ba'i khang pa rtsig tu bcug cing bsnyung ba'i sman yang 'jog tu bcug / bde ba'i sman dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang /
translated: departed from the Blessed One’s presence, and had a sickroom built, and had medicine for the sick provided. He had medicine for comfort provided, medicine suitable for the morning, medicine suitable for the afternoon, medicine suitable for seven days,

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / rtsa ba'i sman dang / sdong bu'i sman dang / lo ma'i sman dang / me tog gi sman dang / 'bras bu'i sman dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / zhun mar bskol du bcug pa dang / ma bskol ba dag kyang 'jog tu bcug /'bru mar bskol ba dang ma bskol ba dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / bdag dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / rtsa ba'i sman dang / sdong bu'i sman dang / lo ma'i sman dang / me tog gi sman dang / 'bras bu'i sman dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / zhun mar bskol du bcug pa dang / ma bskol ba dag kyang 'jog tu bcug /'bru mar bskol ba dang ma bskol ba dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / bdag dang /
translated: medicine to be kept for life, root medicine, stem medicine, leaf medicine, flower medicine, and fruit medicine provided. He had oil for cooking and oil for not cooking provided, and had grain for cooking and grain for not cooking provided. He had himself,

original: ma he dang / ra bzhon dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / yo byad thams cad kyang 'jog tu bcug / sman dang snyun g-yog dag kyang 'jog tu bcug ste /
analyzed: ma he dang / ra bzhon dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / yo byad thams cad kyang 'jog tu bcug / sman dang snyun g-yog dag kyang 'jog tu bcug ste /
translated: He also had buffaloes and horses placed there, and all the necessary provisions, and also medicine and nurses.

original: dge slong dag la yang yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag la yang yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs so //
translated: He also provided all the necessary provisions for the monks.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' bca' ba dang bza' ba 'di lta bu rnyed kyis thabs shig bya'o zhes de dag gis sman pa la dris pa /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bca' ba dang bza' ba 'di lta bu rnyed kyis thabs shig bya'o zhes de dag gis sman pa la dris pa /
translated: “Nandaka and Upanandaka have obtained such food and drink. We must do something.” They asked a doctor,

original: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag la nad ci yod pa je ltos shig / sman pas bsams pa /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag la nad ci yod pa je ltos shig / sman pas bsams pa /
translated: “Sirs, please examine what illness we have.” The doctor thought,

original: 'di dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas bza' 'dod kyis 'di dag dang mthun par smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas bza' 'dod kyis 'di dag dang mthun par smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “These are shaven-headed mendicants. They want to eat. I must speak in a way that agrees with them.”

original: des de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: des de dag la smras pa /
translated: He said to them,

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag ni shul gyis 'du ba pa dag lags pas je skur snum bag gsol la /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag ni shul gyis 'du ba pa dag lags pas je skur snum bag gsol la /
translated: “Noble ones, since you are people who travel on foot, you should eat oily food.

original: de'i 'og tu bska ba gsol cig / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bska ba gsol cig / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: After that, you should eat astringent food.” They said,🔽“

original: dga' bo nye dga' 'di ni sman pa chen po dang / nad kyi gzhi dang / thabs la mkhas pa rgyal po la mkho bo yin te /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' 'di ni sman pa chen po dang / nad kyi gzhi dang / thabs la mkhas pa rgyal po la mkho bo yin te /
translated: “Nanda and Upananda are the great physicians, the basis of the disease, and skilled in the means.

original: gal te bdag cag thams cad kyis dus gcig tu de ltar bya bar brtsams na /
analyzed: gal te bdag cag thams cad kyis dus gcig tu de ltar bya bar brtsams na /
translated: If all of us were to begin this at the same time,

original: myur du zin par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: myur du zin par 'gyur gyis /
translated: it would be quickly completed.

original: je dang por gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing /
analyzed: je dang por gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing /
translated: First, two of us will give the oil treatment,

original: bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
analyzed: bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
translated: and four will nurse the patient.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing /
translated: After that, two more will give the oil treatment,

original: bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
analyzed: bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
translated: and four will nurse the patient.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
translated: After that, two more will give the oil treatment and four will nurse the patient.”

original: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag las gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing /
analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag las gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing /
translated: “Let’s do it that way.” Two of them began giving the oil treatment,

original: bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na /
analyzed: bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na /
translated: and four nursed the patient.

original: @215a * // ji tsam na zla ba gcig 'das so //
analyzed: @215a * // ji tsam na zla ba gcig 'das so //
translated: After a month had passed,

original: de'i 'og tu gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa ni zla ba gnyis 'das so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa ni zla ba gnyis 'das so //
translated: two more began giving the oil treatment, and four nursed the patient. After two months had passed,

original: de'i 'og tu yang gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na zla ba gsum 'das so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na zla ba gsum 'das so //
translated: Then two of them began to prepare the oil, and four of them began to nurse the sick man. Three months passed.

original: zla ba bzhi pa la thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi pa la thams cad 'dus te /
translated: In the fourth month, they all gathered together

original: bza' bar brtsams nas zla ba bzhi 'das pa dang / sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs pa dang / nye dgas phyag tshang la phrin spring ste /
analyzed: bza' bar brtsams nas zla ba bzhi 'das pa dang / sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs pa dang / nye dgas phyag tshang la phrin spring ste /
translated: and began to eat. After four months had passed, Śākya Mahānāman invited the Blessed One for a meal, and Upasena sent a message to the cook:

original: bzhin bzangs deng kho bo la khu sha dang / khu ba dang / sha tshod dag gyis shig ces spring ngo //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs deng kho bo la khu sha dang / khu ba dang / sha tshod dag gyis shig ces spring ngo //
translated: “Good man, today prepare for me meat broth, soup, and meat.”

original: phyag tshang gis smras pa /
analyzed: phyag tshang gis smras pa /
translated: The cook said,

original: 'phags pa dag dgung zla bzhi 'das te sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs na /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag dgung zla bzhi 'das te sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs na /
translated: “Noble ones, four months have passed. Śākya Mahānāman has invited the Blessed One for a meal.

original: khyed kyi bya ba da dung yang ma rdzogs sam /
analyzed: khyed kyi bya ba da dung yang ma rdzogs sam /
translated: Have you not finished your work yet?”🔽Upasena said,

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayana said,🔽🔽

original: bkren sh'akya ming chen kha shin du chen pos sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan 'dren na /
analyzed: bkren sh'akya ming chen kha shin du chen pos sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan 'dren na /
translated: The poor Śākya Mahānāman said, “I will invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks for four months with all the necessities.”

original: gal te spyan drang pa 'di lta bus sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni /
analyzed: gal te spyan drang pa 'di lta bus sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni /
translated: “If it is appropriate to invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks with such an invitation,

original: nye dags kyang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyan 'dren par spro'o //
analyzed: nye dags kyang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyan 'dren par spro'o //
translated: then I, Upāli, will also invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks for as long as they live.”

original: des smras pa khyed cag zla ba bzhir sha dang khu ba sha dang khu ba sha stag zos par gyur kyang /
analyzed: des smras pa khyed cag zla ba bzhir sha dang khu ba sha dang khu ba sha stag zos par gyur kyang /
translated: “You ate only meat and soup for four months,

original: 'on kyang khyed cag smod par byed na /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed cag smod par byed na /
translated: but you still criticize them.

original: gnas brtan gnas brtan gang dag gis zla ba bzhir aa ru ra 'brum bu gcig kyang ma gsol ba de dag ni shin du dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes zer nas ;
analyzed: gnas brtan gnas brtan gang dag gis zla ba bzhir aa ru ra 'brum bu gcig kyang ma gsol ba de dag ni shin du dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes zer nas ;
translated: Those elders who did not eat even one myrobalan fruit for four months are doing something very difficult.”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang slong bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang slong bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: and spread it about.🔽The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de lta bas na /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / de lta bas na /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong gis ha cang slong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis ha cang slong bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks, you should not beg too much.

original: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you beg too much, you become guilty of an offense.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as in the previous story,

original: dge slong gis zla ba bzhir mgron du bso pa bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis zla ba bzhir mgron du bso pa bdag gir bya'o //
translated: said, Monks, you should accept an invitation to a meal for four months.

original: de las lhag par bdag gir byed na de ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par bdag gir byed na de ni ltung byed do //
translated: If you accept more than that, you become guilty of an offense.🔽But you should not count a special invitation,🔽or an invitation again and again,🔽or an invitation for a specific time,

original: so sor mgron du bos pa @215b dang ; yang dang yang mgron du bos pa dang / dus kyis mgron du bos pa dang / rtag du mgron du bos pa ni ma gtags te /
analyzed: so sor mgron du bos pa @215b dang ; yang dang yang mgron du bos pa dang / dus kyis mgron du bos pa dang / rtag du mgron du bos pa ni ma gtags te /
translated: or an invitation for as long as one lives.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: In this case, that is the right time.

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
translated: The place was Kapilavastu.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun /

analyzed: glo bur du gtam zer na /
translated: If one suddenly says, “Speak!”🔽to others who are engaged in a Dharma discussion,

original: ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then one commits the basic transgression of disrespect.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this is

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' @222a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' @222a * //
translated: the Buddha’s word,

original: dang ; dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba'i don dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang ; dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis chos dang ldan pa nyid du bsgo ba'i don dang / gzhan dag chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid do //
translated: the words of the Saṅgha’s legal procedures, the meaning of the injunction by the Saṅgha of monks in accordance with the Dharma, and the Dharma discussion of others.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basic transgression is committed by five factors:

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'am /
translated: the Buddha’s word,

original: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig gam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad pa'i tshig gam /
translated: the words of the Saṅgha’s legal procedures,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don gyi gtam dag las gang yang rung ba nyid dang / chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med pa nyid dang / log thabs kyi bsam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don gyi gtam dag las gang yang rung ba nyid dang / chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med pa nyid dang / log thabs kyi bsam pa nyid dang /
translated: it is not a purification through a legal procedure of confession because of disrespect;🔽it is with the intention to deceive;

original: 'gal bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: it is in opposition.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these is missing, then the verdict is criticized as appropriate.

original: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the seventy-eighth downfall.

original: // / myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the downfall of drinking alcohol

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: yul ngan spong gi phu zhes bya ba na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba /🔽phyug pa / nor mang ba /
analyzed: yul ngan spong gi phu zhes bya ba na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ril khyim bdag rtogs ldan zhes bya ba / phyug pa / nor mang ba /
translated: In the village of Pūgapura in the country of Vṛji, there was a householder named Arita.🔽He was rich, had great wealth,

original: longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba /
translated: and had many possessions.

original: yongs su gzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: He was very wealthy,🔽with the wealth of Vaiśravaṇa,

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor la 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor la 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des /
translated: rivaling the wealth of Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /🔽de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: He took a wife of equal caste🔽and he enjoyed himself with her,

original: dga' ma gur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' ma gur spyod par byed do //
translated: took pleasure with her, and made love with her.

original: de la bu mo gzugs bzang ba /
analyzed: de la bu mo gzugs bzang ba /
translated: A daughter was born to them,🔽who was well proportioned,

original: blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: blta na sdug pa /
translated: beautiful, and attractive.

original: mdzes pa zhig btsas nas de bsrings shing bskyed de chen por gyur nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis dpal gyi 'byor pas bu'i chung mar blangs so //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhig btsas nas de bsrings shing bskyed de chen por gyur nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis dpal gyi 'byor pas bu'i chung mar blangs so //
translated: When she was raised, nourished, and grew up, the householder Anāthapiṇḍada took her as a wife for his son with a great deal of wealth.

original: khyim bdag rtogs ldan de yang rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: khyim bdag rtogs ldan de yang rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: The householder Aḍakavatī also enjoyed himself with his wife,🔽took pleasure with her, and made love with her.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa'i chung ma la sems can srid pa tham pa zhig zhugs nas /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa'i chung ma la sems can srid pa tham pa zhig zhugs nas /
translated: His wife conceived a child in her womb.

original: de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas /
analyzed: de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas /
translated: When she gave birth, a boy was born.

original: de'i ming legs 'ongs zhes bya bar btags so //
analyzed: de'i ming legs 'ongs zhes bya bar btags so //
translated: He was named Supuṣpacandra.

original: khye'u legs 'ongs de khad kyis mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas /
analyzed: khye'u legs 'ongs de khad kyis mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar song nas /
translated: The boy Su­gata gradually went to Śrāvastī and came into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: The Blessed One led him to go forth and ordained him as a novice monk in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de la gdams ngag stsal te des gcig @222b pu dben pa bag yod pa /
analyzed: de la gdams ngag stsal te des gcig @222b pu dben pa bag yod pa /
translated: He gave him instructions, and he remained alone, in solitude, diligent,

original: brtun pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtun pa dang ldan pa /
translated: ardent, and resolute.

original: bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gtang bar gnas pa na dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: When he was dwelling in this way, he actualized arhatship.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa /🔽yul ngan spong gi phu dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa / yul ngan spong gi phu dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the retinue of the saṅgha of monks,

original: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ring byon nas /
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ring byon nas /
translated: traveled through the country of Kāśi and came to the upper reaches of the Sthūlakoṣṭhaka River.🔽They arrived at the bank of the Sthūlakoṣṭhaka River.

original: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la 'jigs rung gi tshal ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la 'jigs rung gi tshal ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: While they were staying in the forest of the terrifying mountain of the nāga-child killer,

original: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis /
translated: the venerable Su­gata

original: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa zhes bya ba 'dug pa yun ring po nas chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la gnas pa'i skye bo kho na med pa rnams la khon du 'dzin pa /🔽mi 'gran pa rnams la 'gran tshol ba /
analyzed: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa zhes bya ba 'dug pa yun ring po nas chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la gnas pa'i skye bo kho na med pa rnams la khon du 'dzin pa / mi 'gran pa rnams la 'gran tshol ba /
translated: There was a nāga named Āmrapālī who had long held a grudge against the people living on the mountain of the sea monster that devours children.🔽He sought to compete with those who did not compete with him.

original: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu bar byed cing /
analyzed: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu bar byed cing /
translated: He sought to quarrel with those who did not quarrel with him.

original: lo thog skyes so cog ma rung bar byed pa de btul nas /
analyzed: lo thog skyes so cog ma rung bar byed pa de btul nas /
translated: He made all the crops grow there unfit to eat.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa slar ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa slar ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: The Blessed One, together with the retinue of the saṅgha of monks, returned to the country of Kosala on their travels.

original: mthar gyis mnyan yod du byon nas /
analyzed: mthar gyis mnyan yod du byon nas /
translated: In due course they arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal /
analyzed: mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal /
translated: In Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove,

original: mgon med zas sbyin gyis kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin gyis kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park, they stayed.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa gzhan ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas der gshegs so//
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa gzhan ni khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas der gshegs so//
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, together with the retinue of the saṅgha of monks, was invited to a meal by the householder Anāthapiṇḍada. They went there.

original: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs ni chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la khyim bdag rtogs ldan gyi chung po grogs bram ze sbrul khas bsdigs pa zhig 'dug pa de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs ni chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri la khyim bdag rtogs ldan gyi chung po grogs bram ze sbrul khas bsdigs pa zhig 'dug pa de /
translated: The young friend of the householder Vṛddhi, who was a brahman threatened by a snake,

original: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa'i 'jigs pas bros te /
analyzed: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa'i 'jigs pas bros te /
translated: fled in fear of the nāga of the Aśvakaṭa River.

original: mnyan yod du song ba kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis glang po che'i bsgo ba'i blar bskos pa des /
analyzed: mnyan yod du song ba kos la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis glang po che'i bsgo ba'i blar bskos pa des /
translated: He went to Śrāvastī and was appointed by King Prasenajit of Kosala as the chief of the elephant keepers.

original: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu de btul ba thos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis klu de btul ba thos /
translated: He heard that the venerable Svāgata had subdued that nāga.

original: dga' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i zan la de'i khyim gzhan du bos so //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i zan la de'i khyim gzhan du bos so //
translated: Out of joy, he invited him to his house for a meal.

original: de nas bram ze des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs bde bar 'dug par rig nas /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs bde bar 'dug par rig nas /
translated: Then the brahman, knowing that the venerable Svāgata was comfortably seated,

original: rang gi lag nas kha zas bsod pas tshim par byas so //
analyzed: rang gi lag nas kha zas bsod pas tshim par byas so //
translated: satisfied him with delicious food from his own hands.

original: bram ze des bsams pa /
analyzed: bram ze des bsams pa /
translated: The brahman thought,

original: btsun pa legs 'ongs kyis kha zas bsod pa zos pas 'ju bar mi nus so snyam du shes nas /
analyzed: btsun pa legs 'ongs kyis kha zas bsod pa zos pas 'ju bar mi nus so snyam du shes nas /
translated: Venerable Svāgata is unable to digest the delicious food he has eaten.

original: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the venerable Suprabuddha,

original: btsun pa legs 'ongs rtsad nan gsol lam /
analyzed: btsun pa legs 'ongs rtsad nan gsol lam /
translated: “Venerable Suprabuddha, did you drink alcohol?”

original: des smras pa 'thung ngo //
analyzed: des smras pa 'thung ngo //
translated: “I drank,” he replied.

original: bram zes glang po che'i chang gi nang du @223a * //🔽mdzub mo btsugs te skom gyi nang du krog krog dkrugs nas /
analyzed: bram zes glang po che'i chang gi nang du @223a * // mdzub mo btsugs te skom gyi nang du krog krog dkrugs nas /
translated: The brahmin put his finger into the elephant’s urine,

original: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la phul lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs la phul lo //
translated: stirred it around, and then offered it to the venerable Suprabuddha.

original: dra bcom pa dag ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis de 'thungs te /
analyzed: dra bcom pa dag ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs kyis de 'thungs te /
translated: Since the venerable Suprabuddha did not think about it, he drank it.

original: yon bshad pa byas nas stan las lngas nas song ngo //
analyzed: yon bshad pa byas nas stan las lngas nas song ngo //
translated: After he had given the gift, he got up from his seat and left.

original: de mnyan yod kyi srang re ldes g-yogs pa las thal nas /
analyzed: de mnyan yod kyi srang re ldes g-yogs pa las thal nas /
translated: He went out through the covered passageway of Śrāvastī,

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis lus la phog pa dang / ra ro nas chang gis myos pa'i shugs kyis sa la 'gyel lo //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis lus la phog pa dang / ra ro nas chang gis myos pa'i shugs kyis sa la 'gyel lo //
translated: and when the sun’s rays struck his body, he became intoxicated by the alcohol, and he fell to the ground.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid mnga' ba yin pas ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid mnga' ba yin pas ;
translated: Since the Blessed Buddhas are by nature free of forgetfulness,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis der lo ma ma yin pa'i sbyil bu zhig sprul pa mdzad de bkab bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis der lo ma ma yin pa'i sbyil bu zhig sprul pa mdzad de bkab bo //
translated: The Blessed One then conjured a hut made of leaves to cover them.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the assembly of monks,

original: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi khyim dag tu gdugs tshod gsol nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi khyim dag tu gdugs tshod gsol nas /
translated: had their meal at the home of the householder Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: yon bshad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: yon bshad pa mdzad de /
translated: After the Blessed One had given the teaching on generosity,

original: gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs te phyogs der byon te /
analyzed: gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs te phyogs der byon te /
translated: he rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de brtul nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de brtul nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew his miraculous power,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag 'di ni gang gis klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa btul ba'i dge slong legs 'ongs zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni gang gis klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa btul ba'i dge slong legs 'ongs zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: “Monks, this is the monk Svāgata, who subdued the nāga Aḍakavati.

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: dge slong legs 'ongs 'dis da ltar sbrul phrug kyang thul bar nus sam /
analyzed: dge slong legs 'ongs 'dis da ltar sbrul phrug kyang thul bar nus sam /
translated: Can the monk Svāgata now subdue even a baby snake?”

original: btsun pa rdo mi thogs so //
analyzed: btsun pa rdo mi thogs so //
translated: “No, Venerable One, he cannot.”

original: dge slong dag de ltar na nyes dmigs 'di dang gzhan dag kyang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa las 'byung bas /
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na nyes dmigs 'di dang gzhan dag kyang myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs pa las 'byung bas /
translated: “Monks, in this way, and in other ways, the faults of drinking alcohol are found.

original: dge slong nga la ston pa'o zhes smra ba de dag gis myos par 'gyur ba tha na rtsva'i rtse mos btung bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong nga la ston pa'o zhes smra ba de dag gis myos par 'gyur ba tha na rtsva'i rtse mos btung bar mi bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, monks who say, ‘I am a teacher of the Buddha,’ should not drink alcohol, even as little as the tip of a blade of grass,

original: blud par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: blud par yang mi bya'o //
translated: nor should they cause others to drink it.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs sad par mdzad nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs sad par mdzad nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One woke up the venerable Subhadra and said,

original: legs 'ongs ci'i phyir 'di ltar gyur /
analyzed: legs 'ongs ci'i phyir 'di ltar gyur /
translated: “Subhadra, why did you do this?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bsams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bsams so //
translated: “Blessed One, I did not think.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa ma bsams so //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang du gshegs te byon nas /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ma bsams so // de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang du gshegs te byon nas /
translated: “Sugata, I did not think.”🔽Then the Blessed One went to the temple and sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs nas snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs nas snga ma bzhin du /
translated: As before, he said to the monks,🔽“Monks, in this way, and in other ways, the faults of drinking alcohol are found.

original: 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par @223b 'gyur ba 'thungs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par @223b 'gyur ba 'thungs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa legs 'ongs /
translated: The person was the venerable Subhadra.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bsam bsams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bsam bsams pa /
translated: The affliction was the non-purification of habitual tendencies.

original: nyes pa ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'o //
translated: The fault was drinking alcohol.

original: de la 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni chan gyi btung ba dang / babs kyi btung ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni chan gyi btung ba dang / babs kyi btung ba'o //
translated: Alcohol means a drink made from grain or a drink made from fruit.

original: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A drink made from fruit means

original: rtsa ba'i btung ba dang / sdong bu'i btung ba dang / 'dab ma'i btung ba dang / me tog gi btung ba dang / 'bras bu'i ba tung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i btung ba dang / sdong bu'i btung ba dang / 'dab ma'i btung ba dang / me tog gi btung ba dang / 'bras bu'i ba tung ba'o //
translated: a drink made from roots, a drink made from stems, a drink made from leaves, a drink made from flowers, or a drink made from fruits.

original: de dag gnyi ga bsres pa'i 'bru'i chad dang / bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba'o //🔽myos par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na myos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga bsres pa'i 'bru'i chad dang / bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba'o // myos par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'thungs na myos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A drink made from grain and a drink made from fruit mixed together is called “alcohol.”🔽It is called “alcohol” because drinking it makes one intoxicated.

original: 'thungs na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'thungs na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: Drinking it means swallowing it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba ma bskol ba dang / 'bru'i chang gi spang ma dang / bcos pa'i chang gi tshigs ma myos par 'gyur ba mgul du mid na myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: des dang du blangs nas de bzhin du spyan drangs so //
translated: He accepted and invited them in that way.

original: chos nyid kyis na gang gi ngor dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de dus sngar 'gro ba yin pas /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis na gang gi ngor dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de dus sngar 'gro ba yin pas /
translated: It is natural that whoever invites the saṅgha of monks to a meal goes first.

original: tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' dus sngar der song nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' dus sngar der song nas /
translated: The venerable Upasena went there first.

original: des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
analyzed: des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
translated: He said to the householder,

original: khyim bdag kho bo sbyin bdag gi khyim dag lta ba'i bar du /
analyzed: khyim bdag kho bo sbyin bdag gi khyim dag lta ba'i bar du /
translated: “Householder, I will go to the houses of the benefactors.🔽You should prepare the food for a while.

original: khyed re zhig zas sta gon gyis shig / kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i bar du yang khyed kyis re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes smras te song ngo //
analyzed: khyed re zhig zas sta gon gyis shig / kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i bar du yang khyed kyis re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes smras te song ngo //
translated: You should not serve it until I come.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yang /
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of monks,

original: des ma bskul bar /
analyzed: des ma bskul bar /
translated: without being invited,

original: sngar khyim bdag de'i khyim gal ba der gshegs te sgo drung na gzhes so //
analyzed: sngar khyim bdag de'i khyim gal ba der gshegs te sgo drung na gzhes so //
translated: went to the householder’s house and waited at the door.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la ci bder gyis shig ces bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la ci bder gyis shig ces bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: 'phags pa bdag gis khyed cag gi ci bder ci legs ma 'tshal gyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gis khyed cag gi ci bder ci legs ma 'tshal gyis /
translated: “Noble one, I don’t know what is good for you.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag kho na'i slad du gdan dag bshams kyis bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag kho na'i slad du gdan dag bshams kyis bzhugs su gsol /
translated: In this way, I have prepared seats just for you. Please sit down.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One, the Blessed One said,

original: gal te de skad zer na khyed cag kho na'i phyir stan dag bshams pas ci bder byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de skad zer na khyed cag kho na'i phyir stan dag bshams pas ci bder byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “If he says this, you should say, ‘We will say that we have done what we like, since seats have been prepared just for us.

original: 'dug par bya zhing 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug par bya zhing 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: We will sit down and not regret it.’

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod la bab tu nye na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bzhugs pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod la bab tu nye na /
translated: When the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks were seated, it was almost time for the midday meal.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la gdugs tshod la bab du @227b nyes ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la gdugs tshod la bab du @227b nyes ;
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, “Tell the householder that it is time for the midday meal and that he should serve it. What will you do with this spoiled food?”

original: zhal zas brims shig / zas 'dis khyod la ci bya zhes bya ba bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: zhal zas brims shig / zas 'dis khyod la ci bya zhes bya ba bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

analyzed: 'phags pa nye dga' mchi ba'i bar du yud tsam zhig gzhes su gsol /
translated: “Noble one, please wait a moment until the venerable Upasena arrives.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
translated: The venerable Ānanda

original: bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yud tsam zhig gzhes nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yud tsam zhig gzhes nas /
translated: told the Blessed One what had happened, and the Blessed One said, “Wait a moment.”

original: yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
analyzed: yang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
translated: Again, the venerable Ānanda

original: khyim bdag de la gdugs tshod la bab kyis zhal zas brims shig / zas rul par gyur pa 'dis khyod la ci bya zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de la gdugs tshod la bab kyis zhal zas brims shig / zas rul par gyur pa 'dis khyod la ci bya zhes bsgo ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: told the householder that it was time for the midday meal and that he should serve it. What will you do with this spoiled food?” The householder said,

original: 'phags pa nye dga'am mchi bar du yud tsam zhig gzhes su gsol /
analyzed: 'phags pa nye dga'am mchi bar du yud tsam zhig gzhes su gsol /
translated: “Noble one, please wait a moment until the venerable Upasena arrives.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
translated: The venerable Ānanda🔽told the Blessed One what had happened, and the Blessed One said, “Wait a moment.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la nye dga' 'ongs par ma gyur na zan sbyin par mi byed dam zhes smras pa dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyim bdag de la nye dga' 'ongs par ma gyur na zan sbyin par mi byed dam zhes smras pa dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: 'phags pa mi gsol lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi gsol lo //
translated: “Noble one, he did not eat.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la de skad ces gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the venerable Ānanda had thus spoken to the Lord, then the Lord spoke this verse:

original: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
translated: “All that is dependent is suffering.

original: bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin //
analyzed: bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin //
translated: All that is independent is happiness.

original: thun mong dag gis gnod byed do //
analyzed: thun mong dag gis gnod byed do //
translated: The shared is harmful.

original: 'brel pa shin du 'da' bar bka' //
analyzed: 'brel pa shin du 'da' bar bka' //
translated: The connection is very much to be transcended.”

original: ci tsam na gdugs tshod kyi mtha' la bab pa na /
analyzed: ci tsam na gdugs tshod kyi mtha' la bab pa na /
translated: When it was time for the midday meal,

original: nye dga' 'ongs nas des smras pa //
analyzed: nye dga' 'ongs nas des smras pa //
translated: Upasena came and said,

original: khyim bdag mi 'brim par ci gdong //
analyzed: khyim bdag mi 'brim par ci gdong //
translated: “Householder, why are you not serving?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi zhal nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi zhal nas /
translated: “Noble one, from your mouth

original: kho bo ma 'ongs kyi bar du re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes byung la de skad ces mi gsung ngam /
analyzed: kho bo ma 'ongs kyi bar du re zhig brim par mi bya'o zhes byung la de skad ces mi gsung ngam /
translated: “I will not distribute it for a while.”

original: nye dga' shags med nas cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
analyzed: nye dga' shags med nas cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
translated: Upasena, not wanting to argue, remained silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag des brim par brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des brim par brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas /
translated: Then the householder began to distribute the food, but by the time he got around to it, it was past noon.

original: dge slong kha cig gis ni zas thob nas zan gcad pa byas /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig gis ni zas thob nas zan gcad pa byas /
translated: Some monks had already eaten, so they had to fast.

original: kha cig gis ni zan ma thob pa kho nar zan gcad pa byas nas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni zan ma thob pa kho nar zan gcad pa byas nas /
translated: Some had not eaten, but they also had to fast.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bshad pa mdzad de gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bshad pa mdzad de gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One gave the householder a Dharma talk and then left.

original: nye dga' ngo tsha bar gyur pa'i snying gis de nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: nye dga' ngo tsha bar gyur pa'i snying gis de nyid du 'dug go //
translated: Upasena, feeling ashamed, remained right where he was.

original: de'i nyin mo gso sbyong gi zhal ta ba rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i nyin mo gso sbyong gi zhal ta ba rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste /
translated: That day the monk who was the most senior of those in charge of the observance-day ceremony was sitting at the end of the row.🔽He addressed the monks:

original: dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo zhing smras pa /🔽btsun pa nye @228a * //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo zhing smras pa / btsun pa nye @228a * //
translated: “Venerables,

original: dga' ma mchis sam /
analyzed: dga' ma mchis sam /
translated: is Venerable Upasena not here?

original: 'ga' zhig gis de'i 'dun pa blangs sam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis de'i 'dun pa blangs sam /
translated: Has anyone accepted his invitation?”🔽The monks said,

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: “Venerable,

original: de ma 'ongs te sus kyang de'i 'dun pa yang ma blangs so //
analyzed: de ma 'ongs te sus kyang de'i 'dun pa yang ma blangs so //
translated: No one else had come to take his place.

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Other monks said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' bdag cag snga dro zang zing gi ched la tho btsams la ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' bdag cag snga dro zang zing gi ched la tho btsams la ;
translated: “Venerable Upasena, we have been busy with worldly matters in the morning,

original: da ni chos kyi ched la tho btsams par byed do zhes zer nas /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi ched la tho btsams par byed do zhes zer nas /
translated: but now we will be busy with the Dharma.”

original: dge slong don nyung du ngag ci'i phyir dge slong dag zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du ngag ci'i phyir dge slong dag zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do monks who have few concerns go to the houses of the faithful for meals and then wander from house to house in the morning and afternoon?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized him, disparaged him, and spread it about, saying,🔽“How can monks who have few concerns go to the houses of the faithful for meals and then wander from house to house in the morning and afternoon?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yang dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas /
translated: “Monks, if you are invited to a house for a meal,

original: snga dro dang phyi dro dag khyim dag tu rgyu zhing khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na /
analyzed: snga dro dang phyi dro dag khyim dag tu rgyu zhing khyim pa 'dug pa la mi bsgo na /
translated: If a monk goes to the houses of laypeople in the morning and evening, and does not inform the laypeople,

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: then, except in special circumstances, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was the monk Upananda.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams kyis kun du spyod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyams kyis kun du spyod pa /
translated: The affliction was the desire to enjoy himself.

original: nyes pa ni zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas /
analyzed: nyes pa ni zas dang bcas pa'i khyim du mgron du bos nas /
translated: The offense was that, after being invited to a house with food,

original: snga dro dang phyi dro dag khyim dag tu rgyu zhing /
analyzed: snga dro dang phyi dro dag khyim dag tu rgyu zhing /
translated: he went to the houses of laypeople in the morning and evening,

original: dge 'dun gyi zang zing gi bar chad byas pa dang / phyi gro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi chos kyi bar chad byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zang zing gi bar chad byas pa dang / phyi gro khyim dag tu rgyu bas dge 'dun gyi chos kyi bar chad byas pa'o //
translated: and thus created obstacles for the Saṅgha’s material needs, and he created obstacles for the Saṅgha’s Dharma activities by going to the houses in the evening.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this case, “a monk” means

original: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: the Śākya Upananda,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽zas dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // zas dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or anyone similar to him.🔽“With food” means

original: mgron du bos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: with an invitation.

original: khyim du zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du'o //
analyzed: khyim du zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim du'o //
translated: “In a house” means in the house of a brahmin or householder.

original: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Having been invited” means for the sake of alms.

original: snga dro zhes bya ba ni snga dro nyid de khyim gnyis las lhag par rgyu na'o //
analyzed: snga dro zhes bya ba ni snga dro nyid de khyim gnyis las lhag par rgyu na'o //
translated: “In the morning” means in the morning, if one goes to more than two houses.

original: phyi dro zhes bya ba ni phyi dro nyid de khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu na'o //
analyzed: phyi dro zhes bya ba ni phyi dro nyid de khyim gsum las lhag par rgyu na'o //
translated: “In the evening” means in the evening, if one goes to more than three houses.

original: khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
analyzed: khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
translated: “In houses” means in the houses of brahmins and householders.

original: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni 'gro zhing ngo //
analyzed: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni 'gro zhing ngo //
translated: “Wandering” means going.

original: khyim pa la mi bsgo na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa la mi bsgo na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one does not ask permission of the laypeople”

original: de na khyim pa gang 'dug pa la'o //
analyzed: de na khyim pa gang 'dug pa la'o //
translated: means of those laypeople who are present.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar mi byed pa de srid du /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi las khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar mi byed pa de srid du /
translated: “Except in such cases” means except in the case of the origin story, where it is said that one should not ask permission of the laypeople who are present.

original: de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par gyur pa de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag @228b ste'o //
analyzed: de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos tshig par gyur pa de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag @228b ste'o //
translated: “If one’s alms-bowl or robes are lost” means if such a situation occurs.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sred par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sred par byed /
translated: The term “offense” means that one will be reborn in the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts, in the lower realms, in unfortunate states.

original: 'tshod par byed /
analyzed: 'tshod par byed /
translated: It means that one will be boiled and burned.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It means that one will fall.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: Moreover, as long as one does not confess and reveal that offense,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: it will be an obstacle to wholesome qualities.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an “offense.”

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the basic offense is defined as follows:

original: dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zas dang bcas pa ni khyim du spyan drangs pa na /
analyzed: dge slong de'i tshig gis dge 'dun zas dang bcas pa ni khyim du spyan drangs pa na /
translated: When a monk invites the Saṅgha, together with its share of food, to his house,

original: sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya shig ces ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs par khyim gsum pa la sogs par rgyu ba dang / gung tshigs las yol ba'i dus ma yin par dge slong 'khod pa la smras su zin kyang brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung bar khyim bzhi la sogs par 'gro na khyim gsum pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin bdag la kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma bya shig ces ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i dbang ma gtogs par khyim gsum pa la sogs par rgyu ba dang / gung tshigs las yol ba'i dus ma yin par dge slong 'khod pa la smras su zin kyang brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung bar khyim bzhi la sogs par 'gro na khyim gsum pa dang /
translated: The actual basis of the downfall is to go to three or more houses in a village, or to go to four or more houses in a town, without being invited to do so, or without a specific need, or without being ill, or without being forced to do so by others, or without being in a situation where one is not in control of one’s actions.🔽The downfall is accrued by going to the third, fourth, or subsequent houses,

original: bzhi pa dang lnga pa la sogs pa dang / khyim bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa la sogs par re rer phyin pa na /🔽grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang lnga pa la sogs pa dang / khyim bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa la sogs par re rer phyin pa na / grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or to the fourth, fifth, or subsequent houses in a town.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The perpetrator of this downfall is

original: snga dro la ni khyim gsum pa la sogs pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'khod pa la ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: snga dro la ni khyim gsum pa la sogs pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'khod pa la ma bsgo ba dang / brtad pa'i bya ba ma byung ba nyid do //
translated: a monk who goes to three or more houses in a village, or to four or more houses in a town, without being invited to do so, without a specific need, without being ill, without being forced to do so by others, or without being in a situation where one is not in control of one’s actions.

original: 'di la yan lag ni snga dro la ni lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ni snga dro la ni lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
