analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'di skad ces zer na'o //
translated: This is what is said means this is what is said.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du gtogs mdo'i nang du 'dus par bdag gis da gdod shes so zhes zer la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du gtogs mdo'i nang du 'dus par bdag gis da gdod shes so zhes zer la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Venerable ones, I have just now understood that this Dharma is included in the sūtras, is included in the sūtras,” he says.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'di yang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'di yang ngo //
translated: This Dharma that the Blessed One taught.

original: de la gal te dge slong rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gal te dge slong rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If the monks also say…”

original: de na dge slong gang dag 'khong pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de na dge slong gang dag 'khong pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: the monks there who are deceitful.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa 'di'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa 'di'o //
translated: “Venerable one,” he says.

original: sngon gso sbyong gi las gnyis sam gsum gyi tshe 'dug pa shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'di so sor thar pa'i mdo lan gnyis sam gsum thos par shes shing ngo //
analyzed: sngon gso sbyong gi las gnyis sam gsum gyi tshe 'dug pa shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'di so sor thar pa'i mdo lan gnyis sam gsum thos par shes shing ngo //
translated: “I know that this monk has been present for two or three poṣadha rites,” he says.

original: lan mang du lta ci smos na zhes bya ba ni lan mang du 'dug par shes pa lta ci smos na'o //
analyzed: lan mang du lta ci smos na zhes bya ba ni lan mang du 'dug par shes pa lta ci smos na'o //
translated: “How much more so if he has been present many times,” he says.

original: tshe dang ldan pa de mi shes pas mi 'grol bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de mi shes pas mi 'grol bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Venerable one, because he does not know, he is not liberated,” he says.

original: de des ltung ba las mi 'grol bas de ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de des ltung ba las mi 'grol bas de ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Since that does not liberate one from that downfall, it is a downfall together with that.

original: de ltung ba gang byung ba zhes bya ba ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: de ltung ba gang byung ba zhes bya ba ni ltung byed do //
translated: “That downfall that has occurred” means a defeating offense.

original: de chos bzhin du byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni 'chags su gzhug pa'o//
analyzed: de chos bzhin du byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni 'chags su gzhug pa'o//
translated: “You should make him act in accordance with the Dharma” means you should make him confess.

original: steng du khyod zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i tshe /
analyzed: steng du khyod zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i tshe /
translated: “Every half month, when the Sūtra of the Prātimokṣa is being recited,

original: gus par byas te chos nyan par mi byed /🔽bla mar byas te mi byed /🔽ru shing ltar byas te mi byed /
analyzed: gus par byas te chos nyan par mi byed / bla mar byas te mi byed / ru shing ltar byas te mi byed /
translated: you should not listen to the Dharma respectfully.🔽You should not regard it as a treasure.🔽You should not regard it as a raft.

original: yid la byas te mi byed /
analyzed: yid la byas te mi byed /
translated: You should not regard it as the peak.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mi byed /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mi byed /
translated: You should not listen to the Dharma with a one-pointed mind.

original: rna blags te mi byed /
analyzed: rna blags te mi byed /
translated: You should not listen to the Dharma with your ears.

original: sems thams cad kyis bsams te chos nyan par mi byed pas /
analyzed: sems thams cad kyis bsams te chos nyan par mi byed pas /
translated: You should not listen to the Dharma with all your mind.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis ma rnyed de /🔽rnyed pa ma yin zhing nyes pa rnyed de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis ma rnyed de / rnyed pa ma yin zhing nyes pa rnyed de /
translated: Venerable One, you have not found what you should have found.🔽You have found what you should not have found.

original: legs pa rnyed pa ma yin no zhes 'gyod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: legs pa rnyed pa ma yin no zhes 'gyod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: You have not found what you should have found.”🔽“

original: tshe dang ldan pa de la 'gyod par bya ba ni de yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gyod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de la 'gyod par bya ba ni de yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gyod par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable, this is what you should regret,” means “you should regret it in this way.”

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “You have committed a downfall” is as above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong dge 'dun zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong dge 'dun zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i tshe /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is presented as follows.

original: sngar yang de lan gnyis su myong zhing /🔽yid rmongs pa ma yi pas bzhad gad tsam gyis kyang so sor thar pa'i @232b mdo gdon pa 'di la /
analyzed: sngar yang de lan gnyis su myong zhing / yid rmongs pa ma yi pas bzhad gad tsam gyis kyang so sor thar pa'i @232b mdo gdon pa 'di la /
translated: When a monk recites the Sūtra on the Basis of Training every half month during the poṣadha ceremony,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i chos 'di'i yod par bdag gis gzod shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i chos 'di'i yod par bdag gis gzod shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: if he says, “I have just now come to understand that this rule of training is in the Sūtra on the Basis of Training,”

original: dngos su smra'am brgyud pa de skad zer na /
analyzed: dngos su smra'am brgyud pa de skad zer na /
translated: whether he says this directly or indirectly,

original: mdo sde dang ldan pa ma gtogs te /🔽de la bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde dang ldan pa ma gtogs te / de la bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: except if he is reciting the sūtra,🔽he has committed an offense entailing expulsion.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this is

original: dge slong sngar yang gso sbyong lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing /
analyzed: dge slong sngar yang gso sbyong lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing /
translated: The monk has already experienced the poṣadha twice,

original: yid rmongs pa ma yin pa dang / mdo sde dang ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: yid rmongs pa ma yin pa dang / mdo sde dang ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: and is not confused, and it is the actual basis of training that is included in the sūtras.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽dge slong slar gso sbyong la na gnyis nyams su myong ba nyid dang ; / yid rmongs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus nyid dang / 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid dang / dngos su'am /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / dge slong slar gso sbyong la na gnyis nyams su myong ba nyid dang ; / yid rmongs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus nyid dang / 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po nyid dang / dngos su'am /
translated: Here, the actual basis is a downfall through five limbs:🔽The monk has already experienced the poṣadha twice,

original: brgyud pas khyad du gsod pa nyid do //🔽de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: brgyud pas khyad du gsod pa nyid do // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: he is not confused, it is the time for reciting the poṣadha, it is the actual basis of training that is included in the vinaya, and he is directly or indirectly disparaging.🔽If any of these limbs is incomplete, then it is a minor downfall according to the circumstances.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the eighty-third downfall.

original: // / khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of making needles and knives.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod na gcer bu pa'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba /
analyzed: mnyan yod na gcer bu pa'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba /
translated: In Śrāvastī, there was a naked ascetic named Dharma,

original: ba so mkhan zhig 'dug pa de gcer bu pa dag la shin du mngon par dad do //
analyzed: ba so mkhan zhig 'dug pa de gcer bu pa dag la shin du mngon par dad do //
translated: a cobbler, who had great faith in the naked ascetics.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig gis chos bstan pas btul nas /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig gis chos bstan pas btul nas /
translated: One day, a monk who went for alms taught him the Dharma,

original: des kyang de la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs so //
analyzed: des kyang de la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs so //
translated: and he took refuge and the precepts from him.🔽Then, that monk who went for alms extensively praised the seven bases of merit that arise from material generosity,

original: yang bsod snyoms pa des de la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa dang / de mngon par dad par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: yang bsod snyoms pa des de la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa dang / de mngon par dad par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: and he became faithful and said,

original: 'phags pa bdag gis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi cung zhig yang dag par blangs te 'jug par bgyis yis /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi cung zhig yang dag par blangs te 'jug par bgyis yis /
translated: “Noble one, I too will undertake and engage in some bases of merit that arise from material generosity.

original: bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun la rang gi bzos bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun la rang gi bzos bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
translated: “I will serve the community of monks with my own hands.”

original: bsod snyoms pa de gtsug lag khang du song ste dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de gtsug lag khang du song ste dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: The alms-begging monk went to the monastery and said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis gcer bu pa'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba so mkhan de skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag nas /🔽de dge slong dge 'dun la rang @233a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis gcer bu pa'i nyan thos chos zhes bya ba so mkhan de skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag nas / de dge slong dge 'dun la rang @233a * //
translated: “Venerables, I have established the naked ascetic named Dharmasvāmī, who is a disciple of the Jains, in the refuges and the fundamental precepts.

original: gi bzos bsnyen bkur byed kyis /
analyzed: gi bzos bsnyen bkur byed kyis /
translated: He will serve the community of monks with his own hands.🔽So let anyone who wants anything have him make it.”

original: su ci 'dod pa des byed du chug shig / ji tsam na dge slong zhig la khab ral med na /
analyzed: su ci 'dod pa des byed du chug shig / ji tsam na dge slong zhig la khab ral med na /
translated: Now it happened that a monk did not have a needle case,

original: de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: so he went to the potter and said,🔽“Sir, I don’t have a needle case, so make me one.”

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo la khal ral med kyis de gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /🔽gang bzang pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo la khal ral med kyis de gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi / gang bzang pa'o //
translated: “Noble one, what kind should I make?”🔽“Make a good one.”

original: 'phags pa ba sa las bgyis pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba sa las bgyis pa bzang ngo //
translated: “Noble one, make it from bamboo.”🔽“Sir, make it from bamboo.”

original: bzhin bzangs / ba so las byas pa gyis shig / des de'i khab ral ba so las byas te byin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs / ba so las byas pa gyis shig / des de'i khab ral ba so las byas te byin no //
translated: He gave him a needle case made from bamboo.

original: dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: The monk showed it to the other monks, and the other monks also had him do the same thing.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i ba so zad par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug / gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i ba so zad par gyur to //
translated: The other monks also had him do the same thing, and the ivory was exhausted.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: Another monk came and said, “Sir, please make me a toothpick.”🔽“Noble one, what kind should I make?”

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /🔽gang bzang pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi / gang bzang pa'o //
translated: “Make a good one.”

original: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so de ni bas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na ba so de ni bas so //
translated: “Noble one, if a good one is good, then that ivory is gone.”

original: gal te bzhed na rus pa las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te bzhed na rus pa las bgyis pa bgyi'o //
translated: “If you want, I’ll make one from bone.”🔽“Sir, don’t do that. Make it from ivory.”

original: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rus pa las byas te byin no //🔽dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rus pa las byas te byin no // dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: He made a toothpick from bone and gave it to him.🔽The monk showed it to the other monks, and the other monks also had him do the same thing.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug /
translated: The other monks also had him do the same thing, and the bone was exhausted.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i rus pa yang zad par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed du bcug pas de'i rus pa yang zad par gyur to //
translated: He also had others do the same, and his bones were exhausted.

original: dge slong zhan zhig kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong zhan zhig kyang 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: A weak monk came and said,

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo'i khab ral gyis shig /'phags pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /
translated: “Sir, please make a needle case for me.” “Noble one, what should I make?”

original: gang bzang pa'o //🔽'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na de ni bas so //
analyzed: gang bzang pa'o // 'phags pa ba so las bgyis pa bzang na de ni bas so //
translated: “Make it good.”🔽“Noble one, if it is to be good, then it should be made of ivory.”

original: bzhin bzangs gal te de lta na rus pa las bgyis pa gyis shig /'phags pa rus pa yang bas so //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs gal te de lta na rus pa las bgyis pa gyis shig /'phags pa rus pa yang bas so //
translated: “Sir, if it is to be so, then make it of bone.” “Noble one, bone is also better.”

original: gal te bzhed na rva la bgyis pa bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te bzhed na rva la bgyis pa bgyi'o //
translated: “If you wish, then make it of horn.”🔽“Sir, don’t make a mistake. Make it.”

original: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rva las byas te byin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ma nyes kyis gyis shig / des de'i khab ral rva las byas te byin no //
translated: He made a needle case of horn and gave it to him.

original: dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
analyzed: dge slong des dge slong rnams la bstan pa dang / dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug cing /
translated: When that monk showed it to the other monks, the other monks also had him make one,

original: gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug //🔽gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i rva yang zad par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug //🔽gzhan gyis kyang de lta bu byed du bcug pas de'i rva yang zad par gyur to //
translated: and others also had him make one.🔽Because he made so many, his horn was exhausted.

original: de rang gi zan dang rang gi yo byad dag gis dge slong rnams kyi las byed pa na dbul bar gyur to //
analyzed: de rang gi zan dang rang gi yo byad dag gis dge slong rnams kyi las byed pa na dbul bar gyur to //
translated: He was impoverished because he was doing the work of the monks with his own food and his own possessions.

original: gcer bu pa dag chos 'di gang gi tshe kho @233b bo cag la mngon par dad par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag chos 'di gang gi tshe kho @233b bo cag la mngon par dad par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the naked ascetics had faith in this doctrine,

original: 'di thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: everything was perfect.🔽But now he has faith in the monks of the Śākya son, and he even begs for food.”

original: 'di de ltar sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams la mngon par dad pa zan yang slong bar byed do zhes 'phya ba la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: 'di de ltar sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams la mngon par dad pa zan yang slong bar byed do zhes 'phya ba la zhugs pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before,

original: yang dge slong gang ba so'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang ba so'am /
translated: “If a monk has a needle case made of bone,

original: rus pa 'am /
analyzed: rus pa 'am /
translated: ivory,

original: rva'i khab ral byed du 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: rva'i khab ral byed du 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: or horn, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po //
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po //
translated: The individuals are the many monks of this doctrine.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen /
translated: The mental affliction is attachment to desire.

original: nyes pa ni khab ral 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni khab ral 'chos pa'o //
translated: The misdeed is making a needle case.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //🔽ba so'am zhes bya ba ni ba so nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o // ba so'am zhes bya ba ni ba so nyid do //
translated: “Monk” means a monk in this dharma.🔽“ Bone” means bone itself.

original: rus pa'am zhes bya ba ni rus pa nyid do //
analyzed: rus pa'am zhes bya ba ni rus pa nyid do //
translated: “ Horn” means horn itself.

original: rva'i zhes bya ba ni rva nyi kyi'o //
analyzed: rva'i zhes bya ba ni rva nyi kyi'o //
translated: “ Antler” means of an animal.

original: khab ral zhes bya ba ni khab ral gnyis te /
analyzed: khab ral zhes bya ba ni khab ral gnyis te /
translated: “ Needle” means a needle, which is of two kinds:

original: sbu gu can dang chang pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbu gu can dang chang pa lta bu'o //
translated: a tube and a bowl.

original: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
translated: Here, both are intended.

original: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam gzhan no //
translated: “ Causes to make” means by oneself or another.

original: bcag nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bag nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcag nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bag nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: “ Having broken, a downfall is to be confessed” means that having broken that thing, a downfall is to be confessed.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “ Downfall” is as above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong gis rin po che ma gtogs pa ba so'am /🔽rus pa'am / rva'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong gis rin po che ma gtogs pa ba so'am / rus pa'am / rva'am /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is presented as follows:🔽If a monk makes a needle case out of bone,🔽horn, or iron,

original: lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral byed dam /
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral byed dam /
translated: except for precious substances,

original: byed du bcug na khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed du bcug na khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one causes another to do it, there is the actual downfall of making a needle case.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa dang / rin po che ma gtogs pa'i khab ral nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa dang / rin po che ma gtogs pa'i khab ral nyid do //
translated: a monk who has the intention of keeping the needle case for himself and who makes a needle case that is not made of precious substances.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽'dod zhen gyi bsam pa nyid dang / rin po che dang / gnang ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang / ba so'am rus pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / 'dod zhen gyi bsam pa nyid dang / rin po che dang / gnang ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang / ba so'am rus pa 'am /
translated: The actual downfall is committed by five factors:🔽the intention of keeping it for oneself, a needle case that is not made of precious substances, a needle case that is not permitted, a needle case that is made of bone, ivory,

original: rva'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral nyid dang / byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs pa nyid dang / rang gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
analyzed: rva'am lcags la sogs pa'i khab ral nyid dang / byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / byas zin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs pa nyid dang / rang gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa nyid do //
translated: horn, metal, and so on, and the possession of a needle case that has been made or the use of one that has been made by oneself or another.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression.🔽This is the eighty-fourth downfall.

original: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bzhi pa'o /🔽// / khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bzhi pa'o /🔽// / khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of making a high bed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal @234a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal @234a * //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī,

original: mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong gang zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas lam gyis dub pa'i ngal bsos te sgo khang du khri dma' ba'i khyim zhig rnyed pa'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug pa gnyid kyis
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong gang zhig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas lam gyis dub pa'i ngal bsos te sgo khang du khri dma' ba'i khyim zhig rnyed pa'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug pa gnyid kyis
translated: At that time, a certain monk, wandering through the countryside, arrived in Śrāvastī. He rested from the fatigue of the road, and in the doorway he found a low bed. He washed his two feet in front of it, sat down cross-legged, and fell asleep.

original: yur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: yur ba'i tshe /
translated: While sleeping,

original: lus 'khyog cing khri'i sgra tseg tseg zer ba na /
analyzed: lus 'khyog cing khri'i sgra tseg tseg zer ba na /
translated: his body twisted and the bed creaked.

original: 'og nas sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa zhig byung bas 'phral bar bzung ste dus la bab nas /
analyzed: 'og nas sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa zhig byung bas 'phral bar bzung ste dus la bab nas /
translated: From below, a snake with swift-spreading poison came up and seized him on the forehead. When the time came,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i drang srong rnams kyis nang du skyes te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i drang srong rnams kyis nang du skyes te /
translated: he was reborn among the ṛṣis of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar 'ongs nas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzhi las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar 'ongs nas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gzhi las /
translated: He came into the presence of the Blessed One and attained the fruit of stream-entry.🔽The basis for this is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,🔽“Whatever faults occur are all due to monks sleeping on low beds and washing their feet in front of it.”

original: nyes dmigs gang cung zad cig byung ba de thams cad dge slong dag khri dma' ba la mal 'cha' zhung de'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis 'khru ba las gyur pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad cig byung ba de thams cad dge slong dag khri dma' ba la mal 'cha' zhung de'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis 'khru ba las gyur pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thinking this, he said,

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya zhing /
translated: “Monks should not sleep on low beds.

original: khri'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: khri'i mdun du rkang pa gnyis bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: They should not wash their feet in front of a bed.”

original: dge slong mchil lham mi bdog pa la gnod par gyur nas /
analyzed: dge slong mchil lham mi bdog pa la gnod par gyur nas /
translated: Monks who did not have sandals were harmed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gis mgo logs dang / rkang pa logs su rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gis mgo logs dang / rkang pa logs su rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
translated: “Those who do not have sandals should wash their feet on the side of the head and on the side of the foot.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not regret this.”

original: drug sde dag gis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab nas /
translated: The group of six slept on low beds. A snake with quick-spreading poison bit them. They died.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bkag pa thos na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis khri dma' ba la mal bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bkag pa thos na /
translated: “The Blessed One has prohibited monks from sleeping on low beds,” they thought.

original: de dag gis khri rkang pa khru bcu gnyis pa bcas te ya gad mthon po btsugs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis khri rkang pa khru bcu gnyis pa bcas te ya gad mthon po btsugs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
translated: “We’ll just make the legs of our beds twelve cubits long.” They did just that, and the monks said to them,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ci khyed byar byed dam /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ci khyed byar byed dam / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Venerables, what are you doing?”

original: su zhig byar byed /
analyzed: su zhig byar byed /
translated: “What do you mean?” they asked.

original: khyed kyis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab pa ma mthong ngam ci /
analyzed: khyed kyis dge slong khri dma' ba la nyal ba sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas zin te dus la bab pa ma mthong ngam ci /
translated: “Don’t you see that a monk sleeping on a low bed was bitten by a poisonous snake and died?”

original: khyed drug sde dag kyang sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas bzung ste /
analyzed: khyed drug sde dag kyang sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pas bzung ste /
translated: “You six are also going to be bitten by a poisonous snake,

original: dus la bab cing kho bo cag shi ba'i yo byad dag 'ged par 'dod dam zhes zer nas /
analyzed: dus la bab cing kho bo cag shi ba'i yo byad dag 'ged par 'dod dam zhes zer nas /
translated: and when you die, we’ll divide up your possessions.”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag / ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun rnams kyis bzlog pa na /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag / ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun rnams kyis bzlog pa na /
translated: “Why do the monks prevent the saṅgha from doing this?” asked some monks who were not very bright.

original: de dang de skad zer zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: de dang de skad zer zhes smod par byed /
translated: They disparage him, saying, “He’s like this and like that.”

original: @234b phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: @234b phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They mock him.🔽They gossip about him.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de na bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de na bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: yang dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am byed du 'jug na /
analyzed: yang dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am byed du 'jug na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, a monk should not make a bedstead or have one made.

original: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad kyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should make it or have it made to the right size, eight standard fingerbreadths of the Sugata.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he makes it or has one made larger than that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The people were the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni lhag tshol ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni lhag tshol ba /
translated: The affliction was malice.

original: nyes pa ni khri rkang mthon po byed na'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni khri rkang mthon po byed na'o //
translated: The offense was making the legs of the bed too high.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: In this regard, “a monk” means a monk in this Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha’s” means the Saṅgha of the Blessed One’s disciples.

original: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
analyzed: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
translated: A bed means a bed.

original: khri'u zhes bya ba ni khri'u nyid do //
analyzed: khri'u zhes bya ba ni khri'u nyid do //
translated: A bench means a bench.

original: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
translated: To have it made means to have it made either by oneself or by others.

original: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the legs and the holes for the legs means

original: gleng gzhi las tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i lus tshad las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg nas /
analyzed: gleng gzhi las tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i lus tshad las shin tu 'das pa yin pas de'i pus mo gnyis ko sko la reg nas /
translated: in the nidana, the venerable Upananda’s body was very large, so that his knees touched the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa de lta bu bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsa ba bu gar gzhug pa ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa de lta bu bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Therefore, except for the legs and the holes for the legs.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad gyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad gyi tshad du byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should have it made the measure of the Sugata’s handspan, adding one-sixth.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //
translated: The Sugata is the Teacher.

original: de'i sor brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
analyzed: de'i sor brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
translated: The measure of his handspan is one cubit.

original: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
translated: If he makes it more than that, means more than that.

original: bcad na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcad na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: If he cuts it, he commits an offense entailing confession, means that after cutting that object, he is to confess an offense entailing confession.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Offense entailing confession, as before.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the basic offense is set forth as follows:

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'i rkang pa bzhin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rkang pa bu gar gzhug pa'i sa phyogs ma gtogs par tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'i rkang pa bzhin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rkang pa bu gar gzhug pa'i sa phyogs ma gtogs par tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang las lhag par byed dam byed du 'jug na /
translated: If a monk makes a bed or bench, or has it made, more than the right size, then, except for the legs and the tenons, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khri rkang 'chos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The basic offense of making a bed or bench with legs that exceed the right size is completed when the legs are made.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this offense is🔽a monk.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri'am ma khri'u rkang pa'i tshad nyid dang / lhag tshol ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri'am ma khri'u rkang pa'i tshad nyid dang / lhag tshol ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The right size of the legs of a bed or bench, and the intention to make them longer.

original: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are four parts to this downfall:

original: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u gang yang rung @235a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri'u gang yang rung @235a * //
translated: the legs of a seat of the community, whether a bed or a bench;

original: ba dag gi rkang pa nyid dang / de dag gi tshad bu gar gzhug pa'i sa phyogs ma gtogs pa khru gang las lhag pa nyid dang / rang gi byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: ba dag gi rkang pa nyid dang / de dag gi tshad bu gar gzhug pa'i sa phyogs ma gtogs pa khru gang las lhag pa nyid dang / rang gi byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: the area of the ground that is one cubit in size, excluding the holes for the legs; the size of the seat being more than one cubit; and making it oneself or having someone else do it.

original: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If one of these parts is missing, one is guilty of a minor offense.

original: khri rkang pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: khri rkang pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the eighty-fifth downfall.

original: // / shing ba la gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / shing ba la gyis gos par byas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of using a seat with legs that are too high

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgya byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgya byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: nye dga' gsar bu yin pa de'i khri thob bo cog rgan pas phrogs shing gnas mal bsko ba'i dus la yang bab nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dga' gsar bu yin pa de'i khri thob bo cog rgan pas phrogs shing gnas mal bsko ba'i dus la yang bab nas des bsams pa /
translated: The seat that Upasena had obtained was taken away by an elder every time he got it. When it was time to assign sleeping places, he thought,

original: gang gis bdag gi khri mi phrogs pa de lta bu'i thabs ci yod snyam pa dang / des bya ba 'ga' zhig gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi khri mi phrogs pa de lta bu'i thabs ci yod snyam pa dang / des bya ba 'ga' zhig gi phyir /
translated: “What can I do to prevent anyone from taking my seat?”

original: shing bal dag kyang blangs nas /
analyzed: shing bal dag kyang blangs nas /
translated: He took some cotton wool for some purpose.

original: de la blo skyes pa shing bal bdal te bzhag go snyam nas /
analyzed: de la blo skyes pa shing bal bdal te bzhag go snyam nas /
translated: He thought, “I’ll spread it out and put it there.”

original: des khri'u'i steng du shing bal bdal te gzhag go //
analyzed: des khri'u'i steng du shing bal bdal te gzhag go //
translated: He spread out the cotton wool on the bench and put it there.

original: ji tsam na dge slong ches rgan pa zhig 'ongs nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na dge slong ches rgan pa zhig 'ongs nas /
translated: Then an elder monk came.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di su'i /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di su'i /
translated: “Venerables, whose is this?”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayī said,

original: kho bo'i shing bal lo //
analyzed: kho bo'i shing bal lo //
translated: “It’s mine.”

original: de na dge slong zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
analyzed: de na dge slong zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
translated: A monk who was there said,

original: nye dga' ji skad zer ba de bzhin de /
analyzed: nye dga' ji skad zer ba de bzhin de /
translated: “Udayī is right.

original: shing bal ni nye dga'i yin no //
analyzed: shing bal ni nye dga'i yin no //
translated: The cotton wool is his.

original: 'di ltar khri ni dge 'dun gyi yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khri ni dge 'dun gyi yin no //
translated: The bench belongs to the saṅgha.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: nye dga' khros nas des shing bal khyer te /
analyzed: nye dga' khros nas des shing bal khyer te /
translated: “Udayī got angry and took the cotton wool.

original: khri de'i steng du shing bal cung zad bdal te bzhag go //
analyzed: khri de'i steng du shing bal cung zad bdal te bzhag go //
translated: He spread out a little of the cotton wool on the bench and put it there.

original: dge slong des so sor ma brtags pa nyid du /
analyzed: dge slong des so sor ma brtags pa nyid du /
translated: The monk did not examine it.

original: der nyal nas mtshan mo nam nangs te langs pa dang / gos thams cad shing bal gyis skya bor gyur nas /
analyzed: der nyal nas mtshan mo nam nangs te langs pa dang / gos thams cad shing bal gyis skya bor gyur nas /
translated: All his clothes were covered with cotton fluff.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /

analyzed: srid du zhes bya ba ni chur ro //

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //

analyzed: de'i mtho'i mtho do gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gsum mo //

original: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //
analyzed: zheng du zhes bya ba ni rgyar ro //

original: mtho phyed dang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtho phyed dang ngo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho byed dang ngo gang yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: The height of the Sugata is four cubits, and the half of that is two cubits. The height of that is two cubits and six finger-widths.

original: srid du mtho gang gis srings shig ces bya ba ni gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: srid du mtho gang gis srings shig ces bya ba ni gleng gzhi las /
translated: It should be spread out to the length of one cubit, means that in the nidana it says:

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i lus tshad las ha cang lhag pas de'i gding ba des mi chog nas /
translated: The Venerable Udayi's body was larger than the standard, so his sitting mat was not sufficient.

original: de gnas mal bsrung ba'i phyir rkang ba'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de gnas mal bsrung ba'i phyir rkang ba'i mtha' logs su lo ma'i chun po dag bzhag pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to protect the bedding, he placed bundles of leaves at the edge of the bed. The Blessed One saw this and said to the Venerable Ananda:

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na srid du mtho gang gis srings shig ces gsungs pas mi chog na srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis bsring ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na srid du mtho gang gis srings shig ces gsungs pas mi chog na srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis bsring ste /
translated: If you make it one hand-span long, it should be one hand-span long according to the Sugata’s hand-span.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gang @236b yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang ngo ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gang @236b yin pa de la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang ngo ste /
translated: And what is the Sugata’s hand-span? It is one cubit and five finger-widths.

original: des na gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phye dang lnga pa'o //
analyzed: des na gding ba'i srid kyi tshad ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phye dang lnga pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the size of the long side of the mat is one cubit and five finger-widths.

original: de la lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de la lhag par byed du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
translated: “If he makes it larger than that” means larger than that.

original: bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po bcad nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: “He commits an offense entailing confession when he cuts it” means that when he cuts the material, he commits an offense entailing confession that is to be confessed.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense entailing confession” is as explained above.

original: de la 'di 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'di 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here is the presentation of the basic offense:

original: dge slong gi gding ba srid du khru gsum zheng du khru do dang sor dug pa /
analyzed: dge slong gi gding ba srid du khru gsum zheng du khru do dang sor dug pa /
translated: A monk’s mat is three cubits long and two cubits wide, with an extra half-cubit for the border.

original: des mi chog na srid du khru phyed dang dos bskyad de /
analyzed: des mi chog na srid du khru phyed dang dos bskyad de /
translated: If that is not sufficient, then it should be one cubit and five finger-widths in length.

original: khru phye dang lnga pa bya'o zhes gsungs pa las /
analyzed: khru phye dang lnga pa bya'o zhes gsungs pa las /
translated: It should be five cubits and five finger-widths in width.

original: chu zheng gang yang rung ba tshad las lhag bar byed dam /
analyzed: chu zheng gang yang rung ba tshad las lhag bar byed dam /
translated: If one has a mat made that is larger than the prescribed size in either length or width,

original: byed du bcug nas gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽'di'i byed pa po ni rang gding ba'i tshad do //
analyzed: byed du bcug nas gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // 'di'i byed pa po ni rang gding ba'i tshad do //
translated: or if one has it made to be the prescribed size but then enlarges it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽The prescribed size for a monk is one cubit and five finger-widths in length and five cubits and five finger-widths in width.

original: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall is accrued by four factors:

original: rang gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gding ba nyid dang / tshad las lhag pa nyid dang / rgyu rung ba nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: the mat is one’s own; it is larger than the prescribed size; the material is suitable; and it is made either by oneself or by a monk who has been appointed.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang ba ni ci rigs par na smad do //🔽gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang ba ni ci rigs par na smad do // gding ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de brgyad cu bdun pa'o /
translated: If any of these factors is not present, the offense is a minor one.🔽This is the eighty-seventh of the Dharmguti🔽.

original: // / g-yan pa gdab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / g-yan pa gdab pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall for having a new felt mat made without a patch is accrued by a monk who has a new felt mat made without a patch that is one cubit in size.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks should make a covering for the itch.”

original: dge slong dag tshad las kha cang lhag pa byed du 'jug nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshad las kha cang lhag pa byed du 'jug nas /
translated: Some monks made it too large.

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis g-yan pa dgab pa byed du gzhug go zhes bka' stsal nas /
